page.title: 01Afon Dysynni,Bryncrug,
page.content: Much of the area is dominated by Fridd cocyn hill that leads down to the valley coastal plains of Afon Dylynni on its north/west side and Afon Fathew on its South. Once again, the land is covered by grass, heath and moorland and used primarily for sheep an catle grazing. There are quite a few farmsteads in this section and the two small villages of Llanegryn in square 1, and Bryncrug in square 9. Bryncrug lies off the A493 road between Dolgellan and Tywyn, and is representative of the many vilages in the area - stone and slate construction situated around numerous churches with localy shop/food/service stores. The independent Talyllyn railway runs along the valley floor of Afon Fathew with Brynglas Station in square 11. This is a one track railway for locals
